Student Athletes,

Ferndale and University High Schools have been approved to resume voluntary training and workouts that will follow strict safety protocols in accordance with MHSAA guidelines. Voluntary training can start on Tuesday, September 8th. Please contact your coach or the athletic director for the time and location of training and safety protocols that will be followed.

Please note that all students must have a physical on file before participating. Students can use the one from last year but they will have to fill out two page of the form. This form is available in the athletic office.

Also, we would like to reiterate that these are strictly volunteer workouts. Every family decision to participate or not participate is fully supported by Ferndale Schools. There is to be no pressure to have students participate, nor will it be held against them if they choose not to attend.

The Alliance of Coalitions for Healthy Communities 2020 Parent Survey

The Alliance of Coalitions for Healthy Communities (The Alliance) is working to reduce substance use issues among youth and adults in Oakland County. Your completion of this survey will help create a better understanding of the problems happening in our community. The Alliance will use this information to inform the planning of future coalition efforts.

The survey is anonymous and will take approximately 5 - 10 minutes to complete.

As a thank you for completing the survey, you will receive a link at the end to register for a chance to win a $100 gift card.

If you have any questions about the survey or are interested in learning more about the Alliance, please contact Mary Ann Vergith, Prevention Program Director, at mavergith@achcmi.org

post_text: Today State Superintendent Dr. Michael Rice visited Ferndale Public Schools. Dr. Rice spent time visiting Ferndale Upper Elementary and Ferndale High School where he connected with students and staff. He started his day at Ferndale Upper Elementary where he visited two classrooms. After departing FUEL Dr. Rice visited Ferndale High School where he met with students from FHS and University High School where they discussed a wide variety of topics from Early Release Wednesday to standardized testing.

The Ferndale Eagles Wrestling team continued their winning ways last night at Avondale High School. The Eagles raised their season record to 7 wins and 2 losses with victories over Avondale 49 to 27 and North Farmington 56 to 12.

Last nights victories gave the Eagles a 2-0 League record as the quest for league and district titles begins in 2020.

Double winners for the Eagles last night were: Martez Squalls, Dylan Coleman, Ameer Joyner, Jeremiah Crisp, Justin Varnadore, Elijah Pool, Mason Smith, Joshua Cook and TJ Smith.

Also winning matches last night were Armand Richey, Christian Renfroe and Dawy Gonzales-Count. Competing for the first time as a varsity wrestler last night was Andrew Merriman in a tough fought match at 103. Anthony Akabuo continues to work hard as our light heavyweight.

Congratulate your friends on the wrestling team! Our next league matches are at Berkley next Wednesday at 5 pm. Go Eagles.

What is World Kindness Day?

World Kindness Day is an international holiday that was formed in 1998, to promote kindness throughout the world and is observed annually on November 13 as part of the World Kindness Movement. It is observed in many countries including the United States, Canada, Japan, Australia and the U.A.E. World Kindness Day presents us with the opportunity to reflect upon one of the most important and unifying human principles. On a day devoted to the positive potential of both large and small acts of kindness, try to promote and diffuse this crucial quality that brings people of every kind together.

Here is a great video that sums up the importance of World Kindness Day and everyday.
